history.proof: intros a b nZb p q r canonical_p canonical_q canonical_r divP_a_b. shelve.

ctx: intros a b nZb p q r canonical_p canonical_q canonical_r divP_a_b.
exceptions.tactic: rewrite (spminusf_pluspf a b nZb p q r canonical_p canonical_q canonical_r divP_a_b).
exceptions.exn: Found no subterm matching "spminusf a b nZb (pluspf A0 (eqA:=eqA) plusA eqA_dec (ltM:=ltM) ltM_dec p q) r" in the current goal.

ctx: intros a b nZb p q r canonical_p canonical_q canonical_r divP_a_b.
exceptions.tactic: rewrite (spminusf_plusTerm a b b nZb p q r canonical_p canonical_q canonical_r (divP_a_b) (divP_a_b)).
exceptions.exn: In environment A : Type A0, A1 : A eqA : A -> A -> Prop plusA : A -> A -> A invA : A -> A minusA, multA : A -> A -> A divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A cs : CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec : forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b} n : nat ltM : mon n -> mon n -> Prop ltM_dec : forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b} os : OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n) a, b : Term A n nZb : ~ zeroP A0 eqA (n:=n) b p, q, r : list (Term A n) canonical_p : canonical A0 eqA ltM p canonical_q : canonical A0 eqA ltM q canonical_r : canonical A0 eqA ltM r divP_a_b : divP A A0 eqA multA divA n a b The term "divP_a_b" has type "divP A A0 eqA multA divA n a b" while it is expected to have type "divP A A0 eqA multA divA n b b".

ctx: intros a b nZb p q r canonical_p canonical_q canonical_r divP_a_b.
exceptions.exn: Tactic failure: The relation (eqP A eqA n) is not a declared reflexive relation. Maybe you need to require the Coq.Classes.RelationClasses library.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type
A1: A
A0: A
eqA: A -> A -> Prop
plusA: A -> A -> A
invA: A -> A
multA: A -> A -> A
minusA: A -> A -> A
divA: A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A
cs: CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA
eqA_dec: forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b}
n: nat
ltM: mon n -> mon n -> Prop
ltM_dec: forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b}
os: OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n)

Goal:
forall (a b : Term A n) (nZb : ~ zeroP A0 eqA (n:=n) b) (p q r : list (Term A n)), canonical A0 eqA ltM p -> canonical A0 eqA ltM q -> canonical A0 eqA ltM r -> divP A A0 eqA multA divA n a b -> eqP A eqA n (spminusf a b nZb (minuspf A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec p q) r) (minuspf A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec (spminusf a b nZb p r) q)

Premises:

mult_mon : forall d : nat, mon d -> mon d -> mon d

original: intros a b nZb p q r canonical_p canonical_q canonical_r divP_a_b. rewrite (spminusf_pluspf a b nZb p q r canonical_p canonical_q canonical_r divP_a_b). rewrite (spminusf_plusTerm a b b nZb p q r canonical_p canonical_q canonical_r (divP_a_b) (divP_a_b)). replace (spminusf a b nZb (pluspf A0 (eqA:=eqA) plusA eqA_dec (ltM:=ltM) ltM_dec p q) r) with (pluspf A0 (eqA:=eqA) plusA eqA_dec (ltM:=ltM) ltM_dec (spminusf a b nZb p r) q) by reflexivity. reflexivity.
